revised_title: High-Resolution Raman Spectroscopy for Molecular Structure and Polarizability Analysis
tldr: This article discusses the use of high-resolution Raman spectroscopy to study molecular structure and properties of gases. It explains how Raman scattering can provide structural information and determine the principal components of the polarizability tensor, offering insights into the electronic structure of molecules. The article also highlights the potential of Raman spectroscopy in understanding molecular vibrations and the limitations of the technique.
